modules.description: This module supports creating and manipulating univariate polynomials of arbitrary degree over a prime field, with core types representing polynomials (`t`) and scalar coefficients (`R.t`). It offers arithmetic operations, evaluation via Horner's method or FFT, interpolation using Lagrange or FFT-based techniques, decomposition into even/odd components, and efficient multiplication algorithms. These capabilities are particularly useful in cryptographic protocols, error-correcting codes, and numerical algorithms requiring high-performance polynomial computations.

This module implements univariate polynomial arithmetic over prime fields, supporting operations such as evaluation, interpolation, decomposition, and efficient multiplication. It works with scalar coefficients and polynomials represented by the `t` type, using finite field elements from a provided prime field module. It is used in cryptographic protocols, error-correcting codes, and numerical algorithms requiring high-performance polynomial computations.
